utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, your food’s getting cold.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll eat later. Right now, I’m suckling at the informative bosom of mother physics.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s hot when Sheldon talks dirty.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, I found this Web site where you send them pictures, they sculpt your head and make an action figure out of you. How awesome is that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let me see.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, you can pick your wardrobe. You can even choose your accessories.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Leonard, you can get a little asthma inhaler.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, this is neat. Think about all the action figures we’ve bought over the years. It would be kind of cool to have ones that look like us. Don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, if that’s your idea of what’s cool, you should get one.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, so, I’m out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What do you think, Sheldon? Want an action figure that looks just like you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Would it come with Kung-Fu grip?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t waste my time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You get that these are personalised action figures.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Honey, if you want one, just get one.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re still out, right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A hush falls over the crowd as Cooper studies the board. He makes his move. He’s dividing both sides by I. He’s adding back the coefficient. He has a value for P. He’s plugging that back in. He takes the derivative, and he solves the equation. The crowd goes wild. Nobel! Nobel!

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Cooper?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nobel. Kripke. Don’t look at my board.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a drawing of a really cool train. Don’t look at that, either. What do you want?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: I have some bad news. You’re working on a gwant pwoposal fow a new fusion weactow. I’m working on a gwant pwoposal fow a new fusion weactow. The university is only awowed to submit one pwoposal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So they asked you to pack up your things and ship out. That’s hard cheese, Barry. You’re one of the good ones.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: No, they’re making us work together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous. I am one of the great minds of our generation. I work on a level so rarified you couldn’t even imagine it. I said stop looking at my cool train!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hmm. Kind of a strange place to put a picture of you and Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I wanted everybody to know I love my wife. And nobody to know I forgot to turn off the laser.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: They’re here. Our action figures have arrived. This is the best five hundred dollars I’ve ever spent.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A thousand dollars on action figures? How can you afford that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Easy. His family’s loaded, and Bernadette has a great job. My wife came with both fun bags and money bags.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Say hello to an exact scale model of me. Oh, I’m not dark chocolate. I’m melt-in-your-mouth caramel.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, man. Look at my nose.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe it’s a shipping problem.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. Maybe Wesley Snipes and Toucan Sam just got action figures that look like you guys.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This sucks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I can’t believe I wasted all that money.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aw, and my girlfriend wouldn’t let me get one. Look at my face. Do I look smug? I feel smug.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I hate it when you make me sit through all the credits.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, sometimes there’s a secret ending, like in The Avengers.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, but I don’t think that’s going to happen in a documentary about the Holocaust.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They could show bloopers. Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That is Sheldon’s “I’m unhappy and about to destroy the planet” music. Come on, let’s just go to your place.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, wait, if he’s unhappy,shouldn’t we talk to him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Shouldn’t we talk to him? Have you learned nothing in six years?

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering apartment)
utterance.content: You doing okay, sweetie?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There is ominous music playing, and there is an afghan over my head. I don’t know where you’re from, but where I’m from, that means I’m not doing okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Want me to make you some tea?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Tea is for when I’m upset. I’m not upset. The university’s forcing me to work with Kripke. I’m outraged.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, cocoa?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, cocoa. Do you have any idea what it’s like to be paired with someone who’s so incredibly annoying?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, teacher! Me! Me!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: See, I did all this great work, and now he’s just going to come along and ruin it. I am angrier than ever and filled with despair.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What beverage do you make for that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no, I know this. Uh, hot apple cider with cinnamon sticks?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, hot apple cider with cinnamon sticks!

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: What the fwig, Cooper? We were supposed to meet in my office a half an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And yet, now you’re in my office. Point, Cooper. Welcome to the Thunderdome, Kripke.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: We agweed to exchange copies of our work. Let me see yours.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why don’t you show me yours first.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: You think I just few off the turnip twuck? We exchange at the same time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How do I know you’re not going to take my ideas and publish them as your own?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: How do I know you’re not going to do that with mine?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because I’m not interested in getting published in Mad magazine. Zingers fly fast in the Thunderdome, Barry.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Are we going to do this or not? Thank you. So, we wead each other’s work, meet again tomowow?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Nice twy. This is bwank paper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I am sure it’s still more valuable than whatever’s in here.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Cough it up, Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: If this one’s bwank, too, I’m going to be fuwious.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You! Always bet on black.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Get that waste of money out of my face.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s only a waste of money if we don’t play with them. He’s right, dawg.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Please, I’m working.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, there is a way we can get action figures to look exactly like us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah? How’s that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Two words, 3-D printer. Wait, maybe it’s three words. No, hang on. Okay, one word, a letter and a number and maybe a hyphen. 3-D printer.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I have always wanted a 3-D printer.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Of course you have. They’re an engineer’s dream. Anything you can design, a 3-D printer can make out of plastic.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, but they’re so expensive.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, come on. You deserve one. You’ve worked hard to find a woman who makes a lot of money.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, the prices have been coming down.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, true. They’re practically giving them away. You know, in exchange for money.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And we can make stuff we need for work with it. Prototypes of my CAD/CAM designs, specialized tools…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not to mention Malibu Koothrappali and his totally bitchin’ dream house.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We don’t need Malibu Koothrappali’s dream house.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really, smart guy? Where’s he supposed to park his sweet little Corvette?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: The monkey in my tobacco study has taken to smoking a pipe. I’m supposed to remove his brain to examine, but it’s hard because now he reminds me of my uncle. You’ve been awfully quiet tonight. Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All right, well, how was work today? Did you exchange your research with Kripke?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I read his research, and, it’s leaps and bounds ahead of mine. Which means the mommy of the smartest physicist at the university is not my mommy as I had thought. It’s his mommy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I wish there was something I could do to make you feel better. May I offer you a consoling hug?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What do we have to lose?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How’s that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I feel like I’m being strangled by a boa constrictor. Why’d you stop?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, Sheldon, we’re going to be late.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t go in today. I’m sick.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re not sick. You just don’t want to face Kripke.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, look.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: See?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What did you do, put this in your tea?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear. Now I’m not even smarter than you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, Kripke’s not smarter than you. You just got stuck on a wrong path. Happened to Einstein. He got stuck on the unified field theory for decades.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, don’t play the Einstein card. His great breakthroughs happened when no one knew anything. So everything was a great breakthrough.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon Lee Cooper, I do not have time for this nonsense. Now, go put your clothes on, get in the car, and lets go to work.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, geez. What a grouch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How did I do that? I got to remember how I did that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do you realize, by owning a 3-D printer, we are reclaiming the manufacturing process and taking jobs back from sweatshops in China?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I think this thing was made in China.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Eh, what can you do?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, I, I think it’s done. Oh, it worked. We printed a whistle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Amazing. You realize these things go for 25 cents a pop at a party store.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And we made it in only three hours. Sounds just like store-bought.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, give me a superhero pose, and I will scan you into the computer for your action figure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, I wish I was in better shape.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stop holding your stomach in. I’ll give you a six-pack with the computer.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, okay, great. Now I can look like Val Kilmer as Batman instead of Val Kilmer as he looks today.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, you can suck it in a little bit.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Cooper, we have a pwobwem. Your work is weawy not at a wevew I expected it to be.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know. Go ahead, mock me. Just use small words so I understand.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Don’t pway dumb with me. We both know what your pwobwem is.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We do?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: You have a girlfwiend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: So my work would suffew, too, if I was getting waid all the time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. That is the reason. My work is suffering because of all the laid I’m getting.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: You wucky bastard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What can I say, you know? She enjoys my genitals. I am giving them to her on a nightly basis.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Okay, stop bwagging. You had some bwiwiant insights in here, but if we’re gonna make this work, you need to buckew down and focus.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll do what I can. But it’s not going to be easy, because when I’m with Amy and our bathing suit areas mush together, boy howdy, is it magic

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, good, you’re home. Got a little surprise for you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Say hello to my little friend.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, my God. That’s so cute. I didn’t think there could be a smaller version of you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know, right? And, thanks to photographs and a little 3-D modeling, here comes the bride.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, Howie, I love these.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I thought you might.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Were they expensive?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Didn’t cost a thing. I made them myself.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Koothrappali and I bought a used 3-D printer for $5,000.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: $5,000 for a couple of dolls? Are you out of your mind?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not just for a couple of dolls. For as many dolls as we want. And whistles.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: At any point, did it dawn on you to talk to me about spending this kind of money?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s kind of dawning on me now.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t believe you. Howie, we can’t afford to waste money on junk like this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are you talking about? We make plenty of money.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I make plenty of money. You make peanuts.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, but we’re married now. That means, when you get sick, I take care of you. And when you make a bunch of money, I get to buy stuff. Sorry if you don’t like it, but that’s how love works.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, here’s how love works. You’re gonna return the machine, or you can print out a working set of lady parts and sleep with those. Oh, my God! Are you actually thinking about it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, I don’t understand. Why didn’t you just tell Kripke the truth?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because the truth made me look bad, whereas a ridiculous bald-faced lie makes me look good. Anyway, if Kripke asks, tell him my coitus with Amy is frequent, intense and whimsically inventive.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is my coitus whimsically inventive?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That is what I write on the bathroom walls. For a whimsically inventive time, call Leonard Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know you’re joking, but I’d be okay with that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. Sheldon, can I ask you a question?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You ever going to sleep with Amy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s awfully personal.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We don’t ask Sheldon things like that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Maybe you don’t, I do. What’s the deal?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, word around the university is I’m giving her sex organs a proper jostling.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, come on, be serious. Look, you guys have been going out a long time. She would clearly like to have a physical relationship with you, so what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, we’re down the rabbit hole. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, first of all, I’m quite fond of Amy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Then what’s the problem?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, all my life, I have been uncomfortable with the sort of physical contact that comes easily to others, hand-shaking, hugging, prostate exams. But I’m working on it, you know? Just recently, I had to put VapoRub on Amy’s chest. A year ago, that would have been unthinkable.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Now you know how I feel when I have to put it on you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Hang on. Are you saying someday you and Amy might actually get physical?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a possibility.

utterance.speaker: Penny (under breath while hitting Leonard)
utterance.content: Oh, my God! Sheldon, I know this wasn’t easy for you, and I’m really glad we could have this conversation.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Penny (under breath while hitting Leonard)
utterance.content: Oh, my God!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you sure you want to do this? Give up your half of the 3-D printer?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes. And can you please make that out to Bernadette? I was taken off the joint account until I learn the value of money.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow, that’s harsh.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Tell me about it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Aren’t you gonna eat lunch?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nah, I blew my food allowance on Pokemon cards.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, the equation balances, but it’s certainly not elegant.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Whatever. You get any wast night?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Gave it to her good, huh?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I gave it to her well. Now, over here, I was thinking the turbulence could be reduced if we just put…

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Was she naked, or was she weawing wingewie?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I didn’t notice.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: How could you not notice?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was too busy squishing all the desirable parts of her body.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Ah, you’re kiwing me, Cooper!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can we get back to work?

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: Sure, sure, sure. You guys ever use any toys?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Toys? I do have a model rocket next to my bed.

utterance.speaker: Kripke
utterance.content: A wocket? You’we a fweak! I wove it!
